docs.lead_paragraph: The drug has faced criticism from those who say the F.D.A. was pressured. But advocates say the move was long overdue, given the options available to men.

headline.main: F.D.A. Approves Addyi, a Libido Pill for Women
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Approves a Drug for Low Libido in Women

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Admin approves Sprout Pharmaceuticals drug Addyi, which will be prescribed to improve women's sexual drive; is first drug of its kind to gain approval; lobbying campaign focused on gender bias inherent in FDA's approval of erectile-dysfunction drugs while ignoring needs of women; critics of campaign say it made mockery of approval process.
docs.snippet: The drug has faced criticism from those who say the F.D.A. was pressured. But advocates say the move was long overdue, given the options available to men.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal health officials on Tuesday approved the first-ever prescription drug intended to treat women suffering from a lack of sexual desire, ending a vigorous debate over the drug's fate.

docs.lead_paragraph: California lawmakers on Tuesday reintroduced a bill to legalize assisted suicide that had stalled amid opposition from the Catholic church and disability rights activists, as leaders among majority Democrats vowed to make its passage a priority.

headline.main: Scott Walker’s Health Care Plan Relies on Tax Credits to Buy Coverage
headline.print_headline: Walker Pushes Tax Credits To Replace Health Law

docs.abstract: Gov. Scott Walker’s health care plan makes a full repeal of Obamacare his top priority, then proposes a system of tax credits that would allow Americans who do not get health insurance through their employers to buy individual plans.
